ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: i learned a lot about photo theory, which i had never been exposed to before.

I developed a better understanding of the power of photography, and even following the end of the semester, the way I interact with photographs has changed dramatically for the better! I really do appreciate photography now in ways Ive never imagined.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths:
- Laura is a great lecturer and made me feel as if my contributions, ideas, and findings were valid, thoughtful, and meaningful.
- i really enjoyed the class exhibition!!!!

weaknesses:
- very dense and formidable readings, especially the ones about photo theory

The seminar style was amazing; focusing the first half of the semester on theory and the second half on practical application was perfect for my learning style. I really encourage more instructors to try it out and see how it works for them/their students.

Professor Wexler is amazing  so kind and so knowledgeable (she is quite literally one of the leading scholars in this field); you really feel like she wants you to learn and succeed. The visits to the archives were absolutely amazing, and I also enjoyed the inclusion of guest speakers and current issues. The first half of the semester is very theory heavy, however, and it was quite a struggle to get through a lot of the readings, and at most times, it seemed like only the grad students understood what was going on. However, Professor Wexler does a great job of summarizing and highlighting key points of texts (especially when you remind her to do so, and she generally is super receptive to feedback), but the content can be very challenging and overwhelming at times.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! Anyone interested in photography, archival research, narrative theory, etc. would really learn a lot from this class! I would recommend it for everyone, but it definitely supplemented my ER&M background perfectly.
